SENT.plain: Neurological, including cecbrovascular, disorders frequently emerge in primary antiphospholipid syndrome (PAS)
Clinical peculiarities of PAS were studied in 113 patients with cerebrovascular disturbances
Structure of cerebrovascular disorders was as follows: stroke (33% cases), transient ischemic lesions (10%), its combination (57%), thrombosis of brain venous sinuses (3%), vascular dementia (27%)
Besides it were found epileptic seizures, peripheral neuropathy, headache, chorea and some symptoms of myasthenia, parkinsonism, multiple sclerosis and psychotic disorders
In all cases antibodies to phospholipids have been detected
Secondary prophylaxis includes regular use of anticoagulants and small doses of aspiriny
